H0.text: who received the most ( but not a majority of ) electoral votes in 1824. John Quincy Adams

H1.text: who received the most ( but not a majority of ) electoral votes in 1824. William Henry Harrison

H2.text: who received the most ( but not a majority of ) electoral votes in 1824. Henry Clay

H3.text: who received the most ( but not a majority of ) electoral votes in 1824. Andrew Jackson

A4.text: Jackson won a plurality of electoral votes, receiving 99 votes from states in the South, West, and Mid-Atlantic.

A5.text: The amendment specifies that only the top three electoral vote-winners are eligible to be elected by the House, so Clay was eliminated from contention.
